paragraphs.text: Great read, thanks James! By 2017 most EU banks will have APIs by law (via PSD2) so this is a sign of things to come. How important is growing a developer community for a bank?

9faeb490c900.title: Its been pioneered by Apple; their app store is best example of how you can grow your brand and…

paragraphs.text: Its been pioneered by Apple; their app store is best example of how you can grow your brand and underlaying products by empowering developers. Its not a coincidence that Tom Blomfield and Jonas Huckestein have chosen to prove their smart bank concept out on iOS first, the ecosystem is full of early adopters and offers a standardised test bed through…

b4f53902c7bf.title: What’s interesting is that most people do not realize that in the US, many banks have APIs via…

paragraphs.text: What’s interesting is that most people do not realize that in the US, many banks have APIs via their core banking provider. The companies that use them have to be vetted. One of these core banking providers, Jack Henry & Associates, released a new platform called the Banno Platform. The Banno Platform includes a modern RESTful API.

91387c693a70.title: THIS is what _every_ bank should provide.

paragraphs.text: THIS is what _every_ bank should provide. I was thinking about it the other day and the only reason I could find is that it could lead to companies writing their own internet banking and selling it to regular people and then doing some “undesired” transaction, but that is so easily fixable… like, read-only tokens, maybe even a proper TOS to avoid…
